catalog.name: NEII Data Services – Conformant
catalog.description:
Conformance for NEII web data services is determined by the [NEII Conformance Framework](http://www.neii.gov.au/system/files/filedepot/1/NEII%20Conformance%20Framework%20Version%201.0%20May%202016.pdf). The framework uses a maturity model approach outlining the various degrees of conformity. Specific principles in the framework include the following:
  • Environmental data are made publically available through machine-readable web data services (published online).
  • Structured metadata will support any NEII data release (well described).
  • Providers will make their data available through under an open licence.
  • Data are provided with support structures that provide enduring operational support to users.
The first principle is mandatory and in the absence of the availability of environmental data through web data services, NEII conformance is not possible at any level of maturity. See the [NEII Conformance Framework](http://www.neii.gov.au/system/files/filedepot/1/NEII%20Conformance%20Framework%20Version%201.0%20May%202016.pdf) for a detailed overview of what constitutes conformance. See [here]( http://www.neii.gov.au/web-data-services/) for a list of NEII conformant web data services and how to access.

items.name: Australian Gridded Solar Climatology (BoM)
items.description:
The Australian Gridded Solar Climatology datasets are long-term averages of solar radiation at the surface over the Australian land mass.

Climatologies are given for two radiation parameters: the global horizontal exposure, which is the total amount of solar energy falling on a horizontal surface over a time interval; and the direct normal exposure which is the total of the component of radiation from the sun’s disk on a plane perpendicular to the beam. Climatologies of daily exposure are given as an annual average and as a set of twelve monthly averages. Climatologies of the diurnal cycle are given as monthly averages of hourly exposures through the day.

These data sets are derived from 23 years (1990 - 2012) of data from satellites operated by Japan Meteorological Agency and the US National Oceanographic & Atmospheric Administration.
